headline.main: SAYS HE WAS NAGGED.; Manager Hoyt of the Victoria Has Given Up His Position.

docs.lead_paragraph: H.L. Hoyt, manager of the Victoria Hotel, gave up that position yesterday. He claims he was unable to get along with Mrs. Florence Stanfield, who owns the hotel, and her son, Douglas M. Stanfleld. With Mr. Hoyt went Steward Ovenden, who had been engaged by him.

headline.main: FEASTS FOR HUNGRY MEN; ALL THE BIG HOTELS KEPT OPEN HOUSE YESTERDAY. MARKETS OF THE WORLD RANSACKED FOR DELICACIES -- TABLES GROANING WITH THE CHOICEST FOOD -- NO PLACE FOR DYSPEPTICS.

docs.lead_paragraph: A feast fit for the gods was spread in the cafe of nearly every big hotel in the city yesterday, and from morning until night all men were bidden to enter and partake of the hospitality of New-York's Bonifaces without money and without price. "Eat and be merry" was the invitation to all. "Drink, If you want to, and have got the price," was, of course, implied.

headline.main: HOTEL GUESTS PAID $962,801,000 IN 1929; Census of 15,577 Houses Shows California First With 1,509-- New York Led in Receipts.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.abstract: Analysis of $962,801,000 receipts in U S for 1930
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27.--Hotels throughout the United States numbering 15,577 had receipts in 1929 aggregating $962,801,000, of which number 2,249 were resort establishments with annual earnings of $76,562,000, according to an analysis issued today by the Census Bureau.

headline.main: Riviera Resorts Unite Against Bargain Hunters; Will Battle 'Something for Nothing League'

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.abstract: Riviera resorts form protective assn against "Something for Nothing League,"
docs.lead_paragraph: NICE, Dec. 27.--Bargain hunters who use "hard times" as an argument to obtain reduced prices for everything and to demand all sorts of concessions from the managements of the gambling casinos have descended like a pestilence on the French Riviera resorts this Winter.
